Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/global/mkmap_db.c

1/* $NetBSD: mkmap_db.c,v 1.1.1.2 2013/01/02 18:58:59 tron Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* mkmap_db 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* create or open database, DB style
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <mkmap.h>
10/*
11/* MKMAP *mkmap_hash_open(path)
12/* const char *path;
13/*
14/* MKMAP *mkmap_btree_open(path)
15/* const char *path;
16/* DESCRIPTION
17/* This module implements support for creating DB databases.
18/*
19/* mkmap_hash_open() and mkmap_btree_open() take a file name,
20/* append the ".db" suffix, and do whatever initialization is
21/* required before the Berkeley DB open routine is called.
22/*
23/* All errors are fatal.
24/* SEE ALSO
25/* dict_db(3), DB dictionary interface.
26/* LICENSE
27/* .ad
28/* .fi
29/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
30/* AUTHOR(S)
31/* Wietse Venema
32/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
33/* P.O. Box 704
34/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
35/*--*/
36
37/* System library. */
38
39#include <sys_defs.h>
40#include <sys/stat.h>
41#include <unistd.h>
42#include <errno.h>
43
44/* Utility library. */
45
46#include <msg.h>
47#include <mymalloc.h>
48#include <stringops.h>
49#include <dict.h>
50#include <dict_db.h>
51#include <myflock.h>
52#include <warn_stat.h>
53
54/* Global library. */
55
56#include <mail_params.h>
57
58/* Application-specific. */
59
60#include "mkmap.h"
61
62#ifdef HAS_DB
63#ifdef PATH_DB_H
64#include PATH_DB_H
65#else
66#include <db.h>
67#endif
68
69typedef struct MKMAP_DB {
70 MKMAP mkmap; /* parent class */
71 char *lock_file; /* path name */
72 int lock_fd; /* -1 or open locked file */
73} MKMAP_DB;
74
75/* mkmap_db_after_close - clean up after closing database */
76
77static void mkmap_db_after_close(MKMAP *mp)
78{
79 MKMAP_DB *mkmap = (MKMAP_DB *) mp;
80
81 if (mkmap->lock_fd >= 0 && close(mkmap->lock_fd) < 0)
82 msg_warn("close %s: %m", mkmap->lock_file);
83 myfree(mkmap->lock_file);
84}
85
86/* mkmap_db_after_open - lock newly created database */
87
88static void mkmap_db_after_open(MKMAP *mp)
89{
90 MKMAP_DB *mkmap = (MKMAP_DB *) mp;
91
92 if (mkmap->lock_fd < 0) {
93 if ((mkmap->lock_fd = open(mkmap->lock_file, O_RDWR, 0644)) < 0)
94 msg_fatal("open lockfile %s: %m", mkmap->lock_file);
95 if (myflock(mkmap->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_EXCLUSIVE) < 0)
96 msg_fatal("lock %s: %m", mkmap->lock_file);
97 }
98}
99
100/* mkmap_db_before_open - lock existing database */
101
102static MKMAP *mkmap_db_before_open(const char *path,
103 DICT *(*db_open) (const char *, int, int))
104{
105 MKMAP_DB *mkmap = (MKMAP_DB *) mymalloc(sizeof(*mkmap));
106 struct stat st;
107
108 /*
109 * Override the default per-table cache size for map (re)builds.
110 *
111 * db_cache_size" is defined in util/dict_db.c and defaults to 128kB, which
112 * works well for the lookup code.
113 *
114 * We use a larger per-table cache when building ".db" files. For "hash"
115 * files performance degrades rapidly unless the memory pool is O(file
116 * size).
117 *
118 * For "btree" files peformance is good with sorted input even for small
119 * memory pools, but with random input degrades rapidly unless the memory
120 * pool is O(file size).
121 *
122 * XXX This should be specified via the DICT interface so that the buffer
123 * size becomes an object property, instead of being specified by poking
124 * a global variable so that it becomes a class property.
125 */
126 dict_db_cache_size = var_db_create_buf;
127
128 /*
129 * Fill in the generic members.
130 */
131 mkmap->lock_file = concatenate(path, ".db", (char *) 0);
132 mkmap->mkmap.open = db_open;
133 mkmap->mkmap.after_open = mkmap_db_after_open;
134 mkmap->mkmap.after_close = mkmap_db_after_close;
135
136 /*
137 * Unfortunately, not all systems that might support db databases do
138 * support locking on open(), so we open the file before updating it.
139 *
140 * XXX Berkeley DB 4.1 refuses to open a zero-length file. This means we can
141 * open and lock only an existing file, and that we must not truncate it.
142 */
143 if ((mkmap->lock_fd = open(mkmap->lock_file, O_RDWR, 0644)) < 0) {
144 if (errno != ENOENT)
145 msg_fatal("open %s: %m", mkmap->lock_file);
146 }
147
148 /*
149 * Get an exclusive lock - we're going to change the database so we can't
150 * have any spectators.
151 *
152 * XXX Horror. Berkeley DB 4.1 refuses to open a zero-length file. This
153 * means that we must examine the size while the file is locked, and that
154 * we must unlink a zero-length file while it is locked. Avoid a race
155 * condition where two processes try to open the same zero-length file
156 * and where the second process ends up deleting the wrong file.
157 */
158 else {
159 if (myflock(mkmap->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_EXCLUSIVE) < 0)
160 msg_fatal("lock %s: %m", mkmap->lock_file);
161 if (fstat(mkmap->lock_fd, &st) < 0)
162 msg_fatal("fstat %s: %m", mkmap->lock_file);
163 if (st.st_size == 0) {
164 if (st.st_nlink > 0) {
165 if (unlink(mkmap->lock_file) < 0)
166 msg_fatal("cannot remove zero-length database file %s: %m",
167 mkmap->lock_file);
168 msg_warn("removing zero-length database file: %s",
169 mkmap->lock_file);
170 }
171 close(mkmap->lock_fd);
172 mkmap->lock_fd = -1;
173 }
174 }
175
176 return (&mkmap->mkmap);
177}
178
179/* mkmap_hash_open - create or open hashed DB file */
180
181MKMAP *mkmap_hash_open(const char *path)
182{
183 return (mkmap_db_before_open(path, dict_hash_open));
184}
185
186/* mkmap_btree_open - create or open btree DB file */
187
188MKMAP *mkmap_btree_open(const char *path)
189{
190 return (mkmap_db_before_open(path, dict_btree_open));
191}
192
193#endif
194
